Package: io.vertx.groovy.ext.jdbc

[Groovy] Class JDBCClient

    • io.vertx.groovy.ext.jdbc.JDBCClient

    • An asynchronous client interface for interacting with a JDBC compliant database

      • Properties Summary

          Type Name and description
          JDBCClient  delegate

      • Constructor Summary

          Type Name and description
          void close()
          Close the client

          Create a JDBC client which maintains its own data source.

          Create a JDBC client which shares its data source with any other JDBC clients created with the same data source name

          Like JDBCClient.createShared but with the default data source name

        • static JDBCClient createNonShared(Vertx vertx, Map<String, Object> config)

          Create a JDBC client which maintains its own data source.

          Returns:
          the client
          Parameters:
          vertx - the Vert.x instance
          config - the configuration

        • static JDBCClient createShared(Vertx vertx, Map<String, Object> config, String dataSourceName)

          Create a JDBC client which shares its data source with any other JDBC clients created with the same data source name

          Returns:
          the client
          Parameters:
          vertx - the Vert.x instance
          config - the configuration
          dataSourceName - the data source name

        • static JDBCClient createShared(Vertx vertx, Map<String, Object> config)

          Like JDBCClient.createShared but with the default data source name

          Returns:
          the client
          Parameters:
          vertx - the Vert.x instance
          config - the configuration

        • JDBCClient getConnection(Handler<AsyncResult<SQLConnection>> handler)

          Returns a connection that can be used to perform SQL operations on. It's important to remember to close the connection when you are done, so it is returned to the pool.

          Returns:
          Parameters:
          handler - the handler which is called when the JdbcConnection object is ready for use.

        • Object getDelegate()
